Apply formatting

Source: R/apply_frmt_methods.R
apply_frmt.Rd

Apply formatting

Usage

apply_frmt(frmt_def, .data, value, mock = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for frmt
apply_frmt(frmt_def, .data, value, mock = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for frmt_combine
apply_frmt(
  frmt_def,
  .data,
  value,
  mock = FALSE,
  param,
  column,
  label,
  group,
  ...
)

# S3 method for frmt_when
apply_frmt(frmt_def, .data, value, mock = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

frmt_def

formatting to be applied

.data

data, but only what is getting changed

value

value symbol should only be one

mock

Logical value is this is for a mock or not. By default FALSE

...

additional arguments for methods

param

param column as a quosure

column

column columns as a list of quosures

label

label column as a quosure

group

group column as a list of quosures

Value

formatted dataset

Examples


library(tibble)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
# Set up data
df <- tibble(x = c(20.12,34.54,12.34))

apply_frmt(
 frmt_def = frmt("XX.X"),
 .data=df,
 value=quo(x))
#> # A tibble: 3 × 1
#>   x    
#>   <chr>
#> 1 20.1 
#> 2 34.5 
#> 3 12.3
